Package dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model

Configuration Data Access This package contains classes to access and manipulate configuration and schema data.

Interface Summary
IModelConstants Constants for Path and Node-Types.
 

Class Summary
Any Operations that apply to all node types.
Attr Handles attribute accessing functions.
Chc Handles choice specific features of a DCtxt object.
Ctr Handles container specific features of a Ctxt object.
DCtxt This is the public interface to access the configuration of a DataModel.
Location A Location supplies the location of one or multiple files and the content type of these files.
Location.Type This class encodes the content type of a persistent model.
Opt This class stores the local options of a DCtxt object.
RCtxt An RCtxt represents a DataModel that has a persistent storage location further called resource DataModel.
Ref Handles reference specific features of a Ctxt object.
TransactionLog This and all derived classes specify a change which has been done at a DCtxt.
Var Variable specific functionality of Ctxt.
XPath This class cotains the XPath related functionality of a DCtxt object.
 

Enum Summary
TransactionLog.TYPE Defines the type of this transaction.
 

Exception Summary
CtxtException All execptions thrown by the DataModel API or of this type.
 

Package dreisoft.tresos.datamodel2.api.model Description

Configuration Data Access

This package contains classes to access and manipulate configuration and schema data.

The core classes to access configuration data and to query the schema are:

  • DCtxt: To access configuration data

Every module that allows user provided functionality to access configuration data passes a DCtxt context object to the user provided functions. Such an object is like a cursor that points to

  • a configuration node (DataNode) or
  • a node of the schema data (SchemaNode).
A context object can be moved via path expressions to another position in the tree (e.g. DCtxt.to( "/AUTOSAR/TOP-LEVEL-PACKAGES/..." )). Or a new context-object can be created for the context-node of the context object or another node (e.g. DCtxt.get( "SubNodeName" )).

Both context-object classes have public variables var, ref... that are bound to objects that allow to do node specific operations: 

        String value = ctxt.var.getString( "Path/to/StringVariable" );

  • Opt: Describes how a context can be configured
  • Kind&Type: Describes distinction between kind and type of a node
  • List nodes & optional nodes: Describes how list and optional nodes are represented in the Public API
  • Navigation: Describes how DCtxt allows to navigate around in the model
  • Query: Describes how to query configuration data
  • Edit: Describes how to manipulate configuration data
  • Transactions: Shows how to group multiple changes into a single atomic operation
  • Transform: Describes how to transform a model when writing an importer for example
  • Expressions: Expression evaluates by DCtxt.getAll() and other methods
